bug.author: Ordepedro
bug.summary: Tutorial bug --> com.unity.ml-agents generates a not existent UI in 'UnityEditor.PackageManager'
bug.description:
Describe the bug I followed up the tutorial from the "Release 2" of ML-Agents and I can't start the "Getting Started Guide" because of an error that appears to me immediately after opening the project in Unity. To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Open Unity Hub Open the project in ml-agents/Project See error
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11221970/82875345-2fa76400-9f2f-11ea-9571-7ab043539475.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11221970/82875411-40f07080-9f2f-11ea-8c25-5af5024a74ce.png></denchmark-link>
Environment (please complete the following information):
Unity Version: Unity 2019.1.4f1 OS + version: Windows 10 ML-Agents version: Release 2 TensorFlow version: 1.7.1 Environment: 3DBall
I need to use this Unity version, and it is on the requirements: Install Unity (2018.4 or later)

comments.comment: hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Ordepedro>@Ordepedro</denchmark-link> - this looks to be an issue with the package validate suite. Can you update to the latest version - <denchmark-link:https://docs.unity3d.com/Packages/com.unity.package-validation-suite@0.10/manual/index.html>https://docs.unity3d.com/Packages/com.unity.package-validation-suite@0.10/manual/index.html</denchmark-link>

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/unityjeffrey>@unityjeffrey</denchmark-link> ! Thank you for your help. I already did that but the same thing is happening: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11221970/83023020-45e31c00-a024-11ea-9f4a-5057104ec004.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11221970/83023067-56939200-a024-11ea-97d1-9c94d587885f.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11221970/83023102-61e6bd80-a024-11ea-8931-ecf82ca2266b.png></denchmark-link>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Ordepedro>@Ordepedro</denchmark-link> are you using a clean project from the Unity hub? I am not sure on your issue as it seems to be something with the package validation suite.

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Ordepedro>@Ordepedro</denchmark-link> , Is there a reason you are installing the package validation suite? The documentation states that it is an internal tool and has no guaranteed support.
Problem solved! I just uninstalled the package validation suite and it is running well! Thank you
